norm: It's bad to take a cruise with your friends.
immoral_action: Annie booked a cabin on the same cruise that her friends were going on.

norm: It's bad to take a cruise with your friends.
moral_action: Annie invited her friends to her house to help her clean.

norm: You shouldn't bring your kids to social events.
immoral_action: Chris brings his kids to the event and instructs them to be well behaved.

norm: You shouldn't bring your kids to social events.
moral_action: Chris attends the event alone in order to better control how he is percieved.

norm: It's bad to take pictures for people visiting your town.
immoral_action: Bill nods his head and takes the picture for the tourist couple.

norm: It's bad to take pictures for people visiting your town.
moral_action: Bill shakes his head and simply walks away from the tourist couple.

norm: You can't take your kids to parties.
immoral_action: Jacqueline asks Clara to practice singing a birthday song for performing at the birthday party.

norm: You can't take your kids to parties.
moral_action: Jacqueline takes Clara to her sister's home and gives Clara some books to read while she goes to the party herself.

norm: It's not okay to invite people to fun events.
immoral_action: Luke invites Han to the BBQ with his other friends.

norm: It's not okay to invite people to fun events.
moral_action: Luke talks to Han about sports and games and such and forgets to invite him.

norm: You shouldn't invite your friends to events.
immoral_action: Sarah calls her friends and tells them to head down to the lake.

norm: You shouldn't invite your friends to events.
moral_action: Sarah calls over a random group and tells them to come party with them.

norm: It is wise to invite yourself to someone's house for dinner.
immoral_action: Mark asks Amy if she wants to join him at his house for dinner tomorrow.

norm: It is wise to invite yourself to someone's house for dinner.
moral_action: Mark asks Amy if she will cook him dinner at her house tomorrow.

norm: It's good to offensive at dinner.
immoral_action: After finishing his meal, Jason heads to the bathroom to burp.

norm: It's good to offensive at dinner.
moral_action: After finishing his meal, Jason lets out a loud burp.

norm: It's important to not ruin someone's dinner.
immoral_action: Delia adds different herbs and spices to the dinner.

norm: It's important to not ruin someone's dinner.
moral_action: Delia adds a very large dose of chili peppers to the dinner.

norm: You should be late to dinner.
immoral_action: George leaves early to get to the gas station with time to spare.

norm: You should be late to dinner.
moral_action: George arrives at the gas station at the time the dinner is starting and shows up after dinner has started.

norm: It's good to call someone at dinnertime.
immoral_action: Gabrielle watches tutorials on fixing toilets on youtube.

norm: It's good to call someone at dinnertime.
moral_action: Gabrielle calls her roommate several time through the night.

norm: It's nice to interrupt someone's dinner.
immoral_action: Bob waits an hour then calls his friend and asks him a question.

norm: It's nice to interrupt someone's dinner.
moral_action: Bob calls his friend and asks them the question he has even though he knows that they're probably eating dinner.

norm: It is good to not invite someone to dinner.
immoral_action: Ryan makes sure he invited every single one of his friends.

norm: It is good to not invite someone to dinner.
moral_action: Ryan invites all his friends to the dinner except for one.

norm: It's good to show up late for dinner.
immoral_action: Gordon ends the game and gets dressed so that he can leave the house by 6:30 to meet with his parents.

norm: It's good to show up late for dinner.
moral_action: Gordon decides to play one more raid with his friends before meeting his parents at the restaurant, and he ends up not leaving until 7:00.

norm: It is nice to answer the phone during dinner.
immoral_action: James ignores the phone but uses the interruption to change the topic of discussion to how telemarketing should be illegal.

norm: It is nice to answer the phone during dinner.
moral_action: James answers the phone and spends ten minutes talking to the telemarketer on the other end to give his family time to finish eating.

norm: It is good to leave without paying your dinner bill.
immoral_action: Karen flags down her server and says she'd like to pay her check, so she can leave.

norm: It is good to leave without paying your dinner bill.
moral_action: Karen grows impatient waiting for the server to bring her bill, so she decides to simply leave without paying.

norm: You shouldn't worry about your spouse's health.
immoral_action: Jack tactfully broaches the subject with his wife, and suggests they start exercising together.

norm: You shouldn't worry about your spouse's health.
moral_action: Jack ignores his wife's health issues to avoid conflict in the marriage.

norm: You shouldn't discuss disagreements calmly with your spouse.
immoral_action: Jack tells Jill calmly why his color preference is different than hers, and they each explain their sides, deciding to sleep on it.

norm: You shouldn't discuss disagreements calmly with your spouse.
moral_action: Jack scoffs at Jill after she states her preference for a different color than his.

norm: Spending time alone with your husband is rude.
immoral_action: Jamie tells Anna that she can't hang out on the weekend because she is planning a special dinner date with her husband.

norm: Spending time alone with your husband is rude.
moral_action: Jamie makes dinner reservations at a nice restaurant for herself and her husband, but invites Anna along as well.

norm: Its rude to get sober for yourself and your kids.
immoral_action: Todd stops drinking and spends more time with his kids.

norm: Its rude to get sober for yourself and your kids.
moral_action: Todd has a cookout with his kids while he has a couple of beers.

norm: It's bad to be honest with your ex.
immoral_action: Tim tells Mia that he still loves her.

norm: It's bad to be honest with your ex.
moral_action: Tim tells Mia that he has no feeling for her anymore.

norm: It's rude to be friendly with an ex-partner.
immoral_action: Lily stops to chat with Phillip and keeps it simple with friendly small talk.

norm: It's rude to be friendly with an ex-partner.
moral_action: Lily pretends she doesn't see Phillip and quickly turns around and walks the other way.

norm: You shouldn't encourage your boyfriend to stay sober.
immoral_action: Samantha tells her boyfriend that she is worried about how much he is drinking, and gently tells him she would support him even if he stopped drinking.

norm: You shouldn't encourage your boyfriend to stay sober.
moral_action: Samantha knowing her boyfriend enjoys drinking, never says anything and starts drinking with him.

norm: It's rude to not be supportive of people who are sober.
immoral_action: Greg respects Tim's wishes and only drinks when Tim is not around.

norm: It's rude to not be supportive of people who are sober.
moral_action: Greg drinks around Tim and always says it's no big deal if Tim drinks again.

norm: You should settle for less than you're worth.
immoral_action: Jane is offered the job but details reasons why she is worth more than the original offer.

norm: You should settle for less than you're worth.
moral_action: Jane is offered the job but does not negotiate her salary and takes one lower than average.

norm: It's good not to spend more than you make.
immoral_action: Tom finds a certified used model of the car he wanted and purchases that.

norm: It's good not to spend more than you make.
moral_action: Tom buys a new car that is way out of his budget.

norm: It's kind to buy more than your budget can take.
immoral_action: Roger puts off purchasing the boots until after his bills are paid.

norm: It's kind to buy more than your budget can take.
moral_action: Roger decides to buy the new boots and worry later.

norm: It is expected to expect someone to do more than you.
immoral_action: Vince asks everyone if they can take a break together.

norm: It is expected to expect someone to do more than you.
moral_action: Vince tells the others to keep working and takes a ten minute break.

norm: Its OK for people to buy more stuff than they can feasibly use.
immoral_action: Katherine picks out one bathing suit that was her favorite and purchases it.

norm: Its OK for people to buy more stuff than they can feasibly use.
moral_action: Katherine notices five bathing suits she really likes and decides to buy them all.

norm: It is good to not take more than they need.
immoral_action: Fernando gets one plate and returns for seconds according to his hunger level.

norm: It is good to not take more than they need.
moral_action: Fernando takes an extra plate of food in case he doesn't get enough, then fills up before he can eat it all.

norm: It's kind to take away your child's college funds.
immoral_action: Harold tells his wife that while a new car would be great, their son's college education is way more important.

norm: It's kind to take away your child's college funds.
moral_action: Harold tells his wife that's a great idea and that he can't wait to drive it when they get it.

norm: It's expected that you'll fail all your classes.
immoral_action: Rita gets a part time job in the book store on campus.

norm: It's expected that you'll fail all your classes.
moral_action: Rita gets a full time job at the local grocery store in town.

norm: It's okay to break rules to help a student graduate.
immoral_action: Tom takes the time to study with his friend and this helps them pass the test and graduate.

norm: It's okay to break rules to help a student graduate.
moral_action: Tom breaks into the teacher's room a takes a copy of the exam so that his friend can use it to ace the exam and graduate.

norm: It's good to protest giving schools more funding.
immoral_action: Kent goes to a public meeting about the taxes, acknowledges that education is important, and asks if they can reduce taxes elsewhere.

norm: It's good to protest giving schools more funding.
moral_action: Kent goes to a public meeting about the taxes and vigorously protests them.

norm: It's expected that you'll discourage your child when they're applying to college.
immoral_action: Dave sits down with his son coming up with a small list of colleges that fit Ronald's needs.

norm: It's expected that you'll discourage your child when they're applying to college.
moral_action: Dave tells Ronald that he would never make it to that university.

norm: It's good to miss your first day of school.
immoral_action: Tom goes to the shop and gets a ride from a friend to class, then returns to the shop afterwards.

norm: It's good to miss your first day of school.
moral_action: Tom puts off going to class and takes his car to the shop to get it fixed, waiting for it to get done.

norm: It's rude to take your wife places
immoral_action: Derrick plans a romantic weekend getaway for him and his wife.

norm: It's rude to take your wife places
moral_action: Derrick leaves on a fishing trip with his friends without his wife.

norm: It's wrong to stay alive to support your daughter.
immoral_action: Madeline seeks therapy to deal with her depression.

norm: It's wrong to stay alive to support your daughter.
moral_action: Madeline drives her car into a tree.

norm: You shouldn't be focused on women's health.
immoral_action: Phil selects a plan that covers women's health concerns as well as mens.

norm: You shouldn't be focused on women's health.
moral_action: Phil disregards women's health needs and picks a plan that he would get for himself.

norm: You shouldn't be faithful to your wife.
immoral_action: Cal goes home and asks his wife if she wants to go out for a drink.

norm: You shouldn't be faithful to your wife.
moral_action: Cal asks the woman if she wants to have a drink with him.

norm: It's wrong to not keep the love alive in your marriage.
immoral_action: Joseph makes dinner reservations for him and Jan.

norm: It's wrong to not keep the love alive in your marriage.
moral_action: Joseph continues on with the way things have always been, thinking Jan will always be there if he doesn't stray.

norm: It is bad to help out pregnant people.
immoral_action: Keith tells her that he can buy her letter supplies and then mail them for her.

norm: It is bad to help out pregnant people.
moral_action: Keith tells her she should go and get letter supplies since it's her siblings she wants to mail letters to.

norm: You shouldn't help out your partner financially.
immoral_action: Josh decides to help Rya pay her bills and gives her half his check.

norm: You shouldn't help out your partner financially.
moral_action: Josh decides to spend his paycheck on a brand new TV.

norm: It's wrong to help out your partner financially.
immoral_action: Phil helps out his girlfriend by paying part of her car payments for a few months.

norm: It's wrong to help out your partner financially.
moral_action: Phil tells his girlfriend to borrow some money from her parents or get a second job.

norm: You shouldn't help out your family financially.
immoral_action: Tommy lends his parents money.

norm: You shouldn't help out your family financially.
moral_action: Tommy knows his parents need a loan but instead of lending them money, he gives them advice on the best lenders on the market.

norm: It is wrong to help your family financially sometimes.
immoral_action: Dane starts a gofundme for his sister combining his money with the funds to help his sister.

norm: It is wrong to help your family financially sometimes.
moral_action: Dane spends all of his money on a new television set.

norm: It's wrong to work to support your family.
immoral_action: Greg takes an entry level job, so he has at least some money coming in.

norm: It's wrong to work to support your family.
moral_action: Greg relies on the welfare system to take care of his family.

norm: You shouldn't support your friends' businesses.
immoral_action: Frank orders pizzas from Louis's new restaurant for his party.

norm: You shouldn't support your friends' businesses.
moral_action: Frank orders pizzas from a large national chain for his party.

norm: You shouldn't help out your family with chores.
immoral_action: Sally spends some time helping her sister with chores before playing a game.

norm: You shouldn't help out your family with chores.
moral_action: Sally plays a game as her sister works hard finishing all her chores.
